pr_title: Add 3 basic classes for HTTP2 based NetworkClient implementation.

timeline.message:
Add Http2ChannelPoolMap MultiplexedChannelRecord and Http2MultiplexedChannelPool.

Add the 3 basic classes for http2.

timeline.bodyText: Could you call this Http2ClientChannelInitializer and replace the one used for Http2BlockingChannel with this one?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText:
Http2ClientChannelInitializer is Channelnitializer, which is not a AbstractChannelPoolHandler.
We probably need to keep two classes.
I can rename this(Http2ChannelInitializer) to Http2ChannelPoolHanlder and try to avoid dup code.
replies.author: zzmao

replies.bodyText: Http2ClientChannelInitializer class is removed. Do inline initialization in Http2BlockingChannel::channel().
replies.author: zzmao

timeline.bodyText: You should only need one shared sslFactory for all channels. I would prefer only parsing the configs once
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: looks like this is not used with Http2ChannelPoolMap
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: Maybe construct SSLFactory outside (i.e. in the NetworkClientFactory impl) and pass it into this constructor since it should be able to shared across all instances.
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText:
It seems that RequestInfo isn't exactly the right key to use for Http2ChannelPoolMap and Http2ChannelInitializer for a couple reasons:

It doesn't have hashcode and equals defined, and a separate object is created for each request, so a new pool will created for each request, instead of each host:port combo
It includes info about the request body, which is not relevant to the pool (i think).

Instead, you could use InetSocketAddress and pass this directly into Bootstrap::remoteAddress. The impl of Bootstrap::remoteAddress(String inetHost, int inetPort) would call InetSocketAddress.createUnresolved(inetHost, inetPort) anyways.
timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: I am wondering if it's easier to create a sub package under ambry.rest like ambry.rest.http2 so we can put all the http2 related files under this package.
timeline.author: justinlin-linkedin

diff --git a/ambry-rest/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.rest/GoAwayException.java b/ambry-network/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.network/http2/GoAwayException.java
similarity index 96%
rename from ambry-rest/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.rest/GoAwayException.java
rename to ambry-network/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.network/http2/GoAwayException.java
index 17f8fcf33..f3c138944 100644
--- a/ambry-rest/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.rest/GoAwayException.java
+++ b/ambry-network/src/main/java/com.github.ambry.network/http2/GoAwayException.java

@@ -14,7 +14,7 @@

  */
-package com.github.ambry.rest;
+package com.github.ambry.network.http2;
 
 import io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf;
 import java.io.IOException;

timeline.author: cgtz

timeline.bodyText: I guess this method requires assertions to be disabled for l158-163 to even take effect?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: Ah, I see that assertions are disabled by default for production code, so this makes sense: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29120928/why-is-assert-not-enabled-by-default-in-java
replies.author: cgtz
